oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1960-06-25 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from June 25, 1960. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Hank Snow (host/performer), guest performers Tompall Glaser and the Glaser Brothers, and regular performers Archie Campbell, Tommy Jackson, Jimmie Selph, the Jordanaires, Chet Atkins, June Carter, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1081st broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Snow; Archie Campbell; Tompall Glaser; Glaser Brothers; Tommy Jackson; Jimmie Selph; Jordanaires; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Hank Snow -- Miller's Cave (Hank Snow, Jordanaires) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner) -- Hank Snow introduces Archie Campbell -- Comedy routine (Archie Campbell) -- Hank Snow introduces the Glaser Brothers -- Twenty-One Miles (Tompall Glaser and the Glaser Brothers) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Hank Snow) -- Hank Snow introduces Tommy Jackson and Jimmie Selph -- Forked Deer (Tommy Jackson fiddle, Jimmie Selph calls) -- Hank Snow talks -- The Last Mile Of The Way (Hank Snow, Jordanaires) -- Hank Snow introduces Chet Atkins -- Limehouse Blues (Chet Atkins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Smathers, Ben, -1990; Stoney Mountain Cloggers; Jackson, Tommy; Atkins, Chet; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Jordanaires (Musical group); Selph, Jimmy; Campbell, Archie; Cash, June Carter, 1929-2003; Snow, Hank; Tompall & Glaser Brothers; Glaser Brothers; Glaser, Tompall; Glaser, Jim
